Package core

Class GameMaster

java.lang.Object
core.GameMaster
public class GameMaster
extends java.lang.Object
Class implementing the game master of That's Life, the central class that provides access to all the methods necessary to play the game

The machine project specifications describe the game as follows (authored by Ms. Shirley B. Chu of the College of Computer Studies):

"That's Life! mirrors life events of people from going to college, having a career, raising a family, investing, buying a house, working, and retiring. The goal of this game is to reach retirement as early as possible with the most earnings on hand.

"The player decides what kind of life he wants to experience during the game. At the start of each round, the player presses for a randomly generated number [1-10]. This determines the number of spaces he will advance on the board.

"Unlike the usual board games, where there is only one path to the end, That's Life!, at some areas along the way, present players with two options: to continue moving forward, or to take a shorter (or maybe longer) route to reach another space on the board."

    void graduate​(int currPlayerID)
    Grants the player (identified via ID number) a college degree, allowing him/her to have a career that requires a degree (for example, Lawyer, Accountant, Computer Consultant, and Doctor)
    boolean isGameOver()
    Returns true if the game is over (that is, all players have reached retirement); false, otherwise
    boolean isMarried​(int currPlayerID)
    Returns true if the player with the specified ID is married; false, otherwise
    boolean isRetired​(int currPlayerID)
    Returns true if the player with the specified ID is already retired (that is, he/she is no longer counted among the active players); false, otherwise
    boolean isRetiring​(int currPlayerID)
    Returns true if the player with the specified ID is already retiring (that is, he/she landed on the end space); false, otherwise
    void keepCareerCard​(int currPlayerID, CareerCard c)
    Sets the kept career card of this player (identified via ID number) to the given career card and resets the current number of pay raises to 0 should this player decide to switch careers
    void keepHouseCard​(int currPlayerID, HouseCard c)
    Sets the kept salary card of this player (identified via ID number) to the given house card and decreases his cash accordingly in payment of the house
    void keepSalaryCard​(int currPlayerID, SalaryCard c)
    Sets the kept salary card of this player (identified via ID number) to the given salary card and resets the current number of pay raises to 0 should this player decide to switch careers (alongside salaries)
    void move​(int numSpaces)
    Advances the position of the player by the specified number of spaces, following the rules of the game (for instance, a player must prematurely stop on a magenta space)
    java.lang.String pathMessage​(int path)
    Returns the informational message related to the path specified
    boolean payLoan​(int currPlayerID, int numLoans)
    Allows the player (identified via ID number) to make the specified number of payments to the Bank, and returns true if the payment is successful; false, otherwise
    void receivePayRaise​(int currPlayerID)
    Allows the player with the specified ID to receive a pay raise
    void retire​(int currPlayerID)
    Performs the instructions when a player retires (that is, when he/she landed on the end space) and removes him/her from the list of active players, effectively excluding him/her from the switching of turns
    void setIndexCurrPlayer()
    Updates the pertinent attribute corresponding to the index of the current player
    void setIsFromWhichPath​(int playerID, boolean isFromWhichPath)
    Sets the attribute of the player related to whether he/she has just landed on a Which Path space
    void setPlayers​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> playerNames)
    Sets the players of the game given their usernames at the start of the game

    Sets the order in which the players are to make their moves

    Returns the message when the wheel has been spun
    int spinWheel​(int currPlayerID)
    Returns the number obtained after the player (identified via ID number) spins the number wheel
    void startCareer​(int currPlayerID)
    Allows a player to draw an applicable career card and drawn a salary card as well to define his career, maximum number of pay raises, salary, tax due, and pay raise
    void startCollege​(int currPlayerID)
    Allows the current player to start college by loaning $40000 from the bank
    void switchTurn()
    Switches the turn, signaling that it is the turn of the next player to move
    java.lang.String toString()
    Returns a string representation of this game master, which includes the list of players

  • Constructor Details

    • GameMaster

      public GameMaster()
      Creates a game master object with the number of players and list of their usernames as parameters

      In particular, all the necessary game components (ArrayList for the players, number wheel, Bank, decks, and discard pile) are created.

  • Method Details

    • setPlayers

      public void setPlayers​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> playerNames)
      Sets the players of the game given their usernames at the start of the game

      Assume that all the usernames are valid and unique. Invalid usernames (e.g, blank usernames and duplicates) are already checked during input, and the user is prompted to correct these before this function is called.

      Parameters:
      playerNames - usernames of the players

    • setPlayerTurns

      public void setPlayerTurns()
      Sets the order in which the players are to make their moves

      Returns:

    • getPlayerDetails

      public java.lang.String getPlayerDetails​(int playerID)
      Returns the details of the player given his/her ID number

      In particular, the details correspond to those contained in the string representation of the player:

      • Username
      • ID number
      • Career
      • Base salary
      • Salary
      • Base tax due
      • Base pay raise
      • Current pay raise (total)
      • Number of pay raises
      • Maximum number of pay raises
      • Current cash
      • Current number of unpaid loans
      • Details about the player's house (name, buying and selling prices)
      Parameters:
      playerID - ID number of the player whose details are to be returned
      Returns:
      details of the player

    • getAllPlayersDetails

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAllPlayersDetails()
      Returns the details about all the players

      In particular, the details correspond to those contained in the string representation of the player:

      • Username
      • ID number
      • Career
      • Base salary
      • Salary
      • Base tax due
      • Base pay raise
      • Current pay raise (total)
      • Number of pay raises
      • Maximum number of pay raises
      • Current cash
      • Current number of unpaid loans
      • Details about the player's house (name, buying and selling prices)
      Returns:
      details about all the players

    • getNumWheelDetails

      public java.lang.String getNumWheelDetails()
      Returns the details about the number wheel

      In particular, the details correspond to those contained in the string representation of the number wheel:

      • The label "Wheel: ", followed by the numbers that can be obtained by spinning it (each value separated by a tab character)
      Returns:
      details about the number wheel

    • getBankDetails

      public java.lang.String getBankDetails()
      Returns the details about the Bank

      In particular, the details correspond to those contained in the string representation of the Bank:

      • Type of game component (Bank)
      • Number of unpaid loans of all the players (arranged starting with the first player to input his/her username)
      Returns:
      details about the Bank

    • getCareerDeckDetails

      public java.lang.String getCareerDeckDetails()
      Returns the details about the career card deck

      In particular, the details correspond to those contained in the string representation of the career card deck:

      • Name of this deck (Career Card Deck)
      • Number of cards initially
      • Number of cards currently
      • String representations of the cards currently inside it (the first card displayed is the topmost)
      Returns:
      details about the career card deck

    • move

      public void move​(int numSpaces)
      Advances the position of the player by the specified number of spaces, following the rules of the game (for instance, a player must prematurely stop on a magenta space)
      Parameters:
      numSpaces - number of spaces by which the player's position will advance

      Parameters:
      currPlayerID - ID number of the current player to graduate

      Switches the turn, signaling that it is the turn of the next player to move

    • setIsFromWhichPath

      public void setIsFromWhichPath​(int playerID, boolean isFromWhichPath)
      Sets the attribute of the player related to whether he/she has just landed on a Which Path space
      Parameters:
      playerID - ID of the pertinent player
      isFromWhichPath - true if the player has just landed on a Which Path space (and remains true until the player has made his next move); false, otherwise

      Returns:
      true if the player has just landed on a Which Path space (and remains true until the player has made his next move); false, otherwise

      public int executeBlueCard​(int currPlayerID, ComputerRepair c, int randNum)
      Executes the instructions indicated in the given Computer Repair blue card
      Parameters:
      currPlayerID - ID number of the current player
      c - given Computer Repair blue card
      randNum - random number dictating the amount
      Returns:
      MATCHED_CAREER if the career in the blue card matches that of the player, NO_MATCH if the career has no match among the players, or OTHER_MATCH if the career matches that of another player

      Parameters:

      numLoans - number of loans to be borrowed from the Bank

    • payLoan

      public boolean payLoan​(int currPlayerID, int numLoans)
      Allows the player (identified via ID number) to make the specified number of payments to the Bank, and returns true if the payment is successful; false, otherwise

      More formally, a payment is deemed successful if it does not cause the player to have a cash deficit.

      Parameters:
      currPlayerID - ID of the current player who will pay loans to the Bank
      numLoans - number of loans to be paid to the Bank
      Returns:
      true if the player is able to pay the specified number of loan payments to the Bank; false, otherwise

      public void receivePayRaise​(int currPlayerID)

      Parameters:
      currPlayerID - ID of the player to receve a pay raise

    • retire

      public void retire​(int currPlayerID)
      Performs the instructions when a player retires (that is, when he/she landed on the end space) and removes him/her from the list of active players, effectively excluding him/her from the switching of turns
      Parameters:
      currPlayerID - ID of the current player

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this game master, which includes the list of players

      In particular, the representation contains the label "Game Master" followed by the names of the players separated by a tab.

      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      string representation of this game master
